CARDINAL . The applicant alleged that since the DATE NORP intervention he had been deprived of his property rights , as his property was located in the area that was under the occupation and control of the NORP military authorities . They had prevented him from having access to and from using his properties .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant joined an anti - NORP demonstration in the ORG area in GPE in which the applicants in the GPE and PERSON v. GPE and PERSON v. GPE cases ( see below ) also took part .

CARDINAL . According to an affidavit sworn by the applicant before the “ GPE ” ORG on DATE , the demonstration of DATE was peaceful and was held on DATE of the NORP intervention in GPE , in support of the missing persons and to protest against human - rights violations .

CARDINAL . The applicant heard about the demonstration from the local radio and press . During TIME of DATE the radio announced that NORP soldiers and policemen had started to cruelly beat the demonstrators . The applicant , a nursing officer , decided to go to the area where the events were taking place . He took with him a special bag containing first - aid equipment and wore an armband marked with ORG sign .

CARDINAL . The applicant told ORG officers that he was a nurse and they informed him that they needed his help for a woman who had received an injury to the head and was lying on the ground . While he was trying to attend to the woman , the applicant was beaten with clubs about the head and body by NORP military personnel and/or other personnel acting under NORP control . Despite his attempts to explain that he was a nurse , they continued to hit him . He felt a powerful blow to the head and started bleeding . He was led away at gunpoint through an angry crowd that shouted abuse and threats and was then taken by bus to the so - called “ FAC ” . The crowd had encircled the bus and was hitting it with sticks and throwing stones at the arrested persons .

CARDINAL . At the garage a body search was carried out and all the applicant 's personal effects were taken . The crowd was shouting and throwing stones at the garage , some of which came through the roof . TIME he was taken to hospital where he had stitches to his head . He was then taken back to the garage . He was still bleeding and his clothes were soaked with blood . TIME he was interrogated by a NORP - speaking officer . The applicant declared that he had joined the demonstration voluntarily for humanitarian reasons . He was told to sign a statement in NORP but refused as he did not understand NORP and signing would have been tantamount to recognising the “ GPE ” ( the “ GPE ” ) .
CARDINAL . In TIME of DATE he was taken to ORG and put in a cell that was dark , damp and dirty . While at the station he was beaten and threatened .

CARDINAL . On DATE he was given back his personal effects and taken to court , where an interpreter explained the charges to the accused . The applicant understood that he was accused of having violated the borders of the “ NORP ” . He informed the judge that he had attended the demonstration only in order to offer humanitarian aid as a member of ORG . The court remained completely indifferent to what he said .

CARDINAL . He was remanded in custody for DATE and then taken to FAC where all his personal effects were taken away again . He was blindfolded and led to another area of the prison where he was interrogated and punched . The interrogation was aimed solely at eliciting military information and the applicant lied about certain details . He was forced to wash the blood from his clothes before appearing in court DATE . After the interrogation he was taken to the central prison .

CARDINAL . The Government alleged that the applicant had participated in a violent demonstration with the aim of inflaming anti - NORP sentiment . The demonstrators , supported by the NORP - Cypriot administration , were demanding that the “ GPE ” in GPE should be dismantled . Some carried NORP flags , clubs , knives and wire - cutters . They were acting in a provocative manner and shouting abuse . The demonstrators were warned in NORP and LANGUAGE that unless they dispersed they would be arrested in accordance with the laws of the “ GPE ” . The applicant was arrested by the NORP - NORP police after crossing the ORG buffer zone and entering the area under NORP - Cypriot control . The NORP - NORP police intervened in the face of the manifest inability of the NORP - Cypriot authorities and ORG in GPE to contain the incursion and its possible consequences .

CARDINAL . No force was used against demonstrators who did not intrude into the “ GPE ” border area and , in the case of demonstrators who were arrested for violating the border , no more force was used than was reasonably necessary in the circumstances in order to arrest and detain the persons concerned . No one was ill - treated . It was possible that some of the demonstrators had hurt themselves in the confusion or in attempting to scale barbed wire or other fencing . Had the NORP police , or anyone else , assaulted or beaten any of the demonstrators , the ORG Secretary General would no doubt have referred to this in his report to ORG .

CARDINAL . The applicant was charged , tried , found guilty and sentenced to a short term of imprisonment . He pleaded not guilty , but did not give evidence and declined to use the available judicial remedies . He was asked if he required assistance from a lawyer registered in the “ GPE ” , but refused and did not ask for legal representation . Interpretation services were provided at the trial by qualified interpreters . All the proceedings were translated into NORP .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of LAW reads as follows :

“ Where CARDINAL or more persons assemble with intent to commit an offence , or , being assembled with intent to carry out some common purpose , conduct themselves in such a manner as to cause persons in the neighbourhood to fear that the persons so assembled will commit a breach of the peace , or will by such assembly needlessly and without any reasonable occasion provoke other persons to commit a breach of the peace they are an unlawful assembly .
It is immaterial that the original assembly was lawful if , being assembled , they conduct themselves with a common purpose in such a manner as aforesaid .

When an unlawful assembly has begun to execute the purpose , whether of a public or of a private nature , for which it assembled by a breach of the peace and to the terror of the public , the assembly is called a riot , and the persons assembled are said to be riotously assembled . ”
CARDINAL . According to section CARDINAL of LAW , any person who takes part in an unlawful assembly is guilty of a misdemeanour and liable to imprisonment for DATE .
